docs.snippet: The rebound effect describes changes that inadvertently raise carbon emissions. A recent study illustrated one such rebound involving crime reduction....
docs.lead_paragraph: The rebound effect describes changes that inadvertently raise carbon emissions. A recent study illustrated one such rebound involving crime reduction.
docs.abstract: Researchers report prison inmates in Great Britain consume less energy than free citizens, leading to finding that reducing crime could actually raise nation's overall carbon footprint and greenhouse gas emissions.

headline.main: How Lowering Crime Could Contribute to Global Warming
headline.print_headline: Carbon and Crime: More Prisoners Means Smaller Footprint

docs.snippet: Cases like Karina Vetrano’s, the jogger who was found strangled near her home in Howard Beach, Queens, tend to jolt us into more cautious habits temporarily....
docs.lead_paragraph: Cases like Karina Vetrano’s, the jogger who was found strangled near her home in Howard Beach, Queens, tend to jolt us into more cautious habits temporarily.
docs.abstract: Ginia Bellafante Big City column examines tragic death of Karina Vetrano, jogger who was found strangled in Spring Creek Park shortly after she went for run not far from her Howard Beach, Queens, home; notes neighborhood has seen uptick in murders over last several years.

docs.snippet: A Somali-Norwegian teenager went on a knife rampage through London's Russell Square, a hub for students and tourists, fatally stabbing an American woman from Florida and wounding five other people....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Somali-Norwegian teenager went on a knife rampage through London's Russell Square, a hub for students and tourists, fatally stabbing an American woman from Florida and wounding five other people.

headline.main: Police: London Stabbings That Killed US Woman Not Terrorism
headline.print_headline: Police: London Stabbings That Killed US Woman Not Terrorism

docs.snippet: The administrator of a $23 million fund of donations for survivors and family members of the shooting at a gay nightclub in Orlando that left 49 patrons dead warned Thursday that squabbling over estate questions could be the biggest obstacle to di...
docs.lead_paragraph: The administrator of a $23 million fund of donations for survivors and family members of the shooting at a gay nightclub in Orlando that left 49 patrons dead warned Thursday that squabbling over estate questions could be the biggest obstacle to distributing the money.

headline.main: Administrator: Nightclub Shooting Fund Up to $23 Million
headline.print_headline: Administrator: Nightclub Shooting Fund Up to $23 Million

docs.snippet: James P. O’Neill and Mayor Bill de Blasio face unresolved problems like the mistrust of officers in minority communities, union contract battles and a corruption investigation....
docs.lead_paragraph: James P. O’Neill and Mayor Bill de Blasio face unresolved problems like the mistrust of officers in minority communities, union contract battles and a corruption investigation.
docs.abstract: Police Chief James P O'Neill is likely to face number of issues in his upcoming role as New York City Police Commissioner, including calls for reform of department, mistrust of police from minority communities, battles with police union and pressure from power brokers in City Hall.

headline.main: Tightrope Walk Awaits New York’s New Police Commissioner, and de Blasio
headline.print_headline: Tightrope Walk Awaits City’s New Police Leader

byline.original: By J. DAVID GOODMAN and AL BAKER

docs.snippet: Ten days before he vanished, Italian doctoral student Giulio Regeni made a Skype call from his Cairo flat to an academic in Germany....
docs.lead_paragraph: Ten days before he vanished, Italian doctoral student Giulio Regeni made a Skype call from his Cairo flat to an academic in Germany.

headline.main: Special Report: In Egypt, an Italian Student Stirred Suspicion Before He Died
headline.print_headline: Special Report: In Egypt, an Italian Student Stirred Suspicion Before He Died

docs.snippet: A jailhouse interview with a German man who joined the Islamic State reveals the workings of a unit whose lieutenants are empowered to plan attacks around the world....
docs.lead_paragraph: A jailhouse interview with a German man who joined the Islamic State reveals the workings of a unit whose lieutenants are empowered to plan attacks around the world.
docs.abstract: Interviews with captured Islamic State group recruits like Harry Sarfo of Germany reveal extent of operations undertaken by group's intelligence unit, known in Arabic as Emni; part internal police force and part external espionage branch, Emni is dedicated to exporting group's terrorist tactics to foreign nations, particularly European countries.

headline.main: How a Secretive Branch of ISIS Built a Global Network of Killers
headline.print_headline: A Global Network of Killers, Built by a Secretive Branch of ISIS
